rev.comment: updating, Canonical no longer requires the ownership/copyright of contributions
rev.diff:
Line 28: Line 28:
XSplash replaced [[usplash]] (which uses the [[Linux framebuffer]]) in Ubuntu 9.10 ([[List of Ubuntu releases#Ubuntu 9.10 (Karmic Koala)|Karmic Koala]]), bringing Ubuntu closer to its goal of a 10-second boot time by version 10.04 ([[List of Ubuntu releases#Ubuntu 10.04 LTS (Lucid Lynx)|Lucid Lynx]]). The improved boot performance over usplash and other boot systems is achieved by prioritizing startup processes related to the X server, and by using a single X server throughout the boot process<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.netsplit.com/2009/09/02/making-a-splash/ |title=Making a Splash |publisher=Netsplit.com |accessdate=2009-10-31}}</ref>.
XSplash replaced [[usplash]] (which uses the [[Linux framebuffer]]) in Ubuntu 9.10 ([[List of Ubuntu releases#Ubuntu 9.10 (Karmic Koala)|Karmic Koala]]), bringing Ubuntu closer to its goal of a 10-second boot time by version 10.04 ([[List of Ubuntu releases#Ubuntu 10.04 LTS (Lucid Lynx)|Lucid Lynx]]). The improved boot performance over usplash and other boot systems is achieved by prioritizing startup processes related to the X server, and by using a single X server throughout the boot process<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.netsplit.com/2009/09/02/making-a-splash/ |title=Making a Splash |publisher=Netsplit.com |accessdate=2009-10-31}}</ref>.
â   â
XSplash is subject to [[Canonical's contributor agreement]], requiring contributors to assign copyright to Canonical, and allowing Canonical to release it under a non-[[Open-source license|open source]] license.<ref name="main">{{cite web | url = http://www.canonical.com/contributors | accessdate = 2010-12-31 | title = Canonical's contributor agreement}}</ref>
